verses.latin: Simon Petrus, servus, et Apostolus Iesu Christi, iis qui coæqualem nobiscum sortiti sunt fidem in iustitia Dei nostri, et Salvatoris Iesu Christi.
verses.english: Simon Peter, a servant and an Apostle of Jesus Christ, writes this letter to those who have received the same precious faith that we have, which is given by the righteousness of our God and Savior, Jesus Christ Himself.

verses.latin: Gratia vobis, et pax multiplicetur in cognitione Dei, et Christi Iesu Domini nostri.
verses.english: May grace and peace be multiplied to you through your knowledge of God and of Jesus Christ, Our Lord.

verses.latin: Quomodo omnia nobis divinæ virtutis suæ, quæ ad vitam, et pietatem pertinent, donata sunt, per cognitionem eius, qui vocavit nos propria gloria, et virtute.
verses.english:
Since God's divine power has given us everything we need for a life of virtue and holiness,
this comes through the knowledge of Him who called us by His own glory and power.

verses.latin: Per quæ maxima, et pretiosa nobis promissa donavit: ut per hæc efficiamini divinæ consortes naturæ: fugientes eius, quæ in mundo est, concupiscentiæ corruptionem.
verses.english:
Through these promises, He has granted us His most great and precious gifts.
These gifts enable you to become partakers of the divine nature,
having escaped the corruption of sinful desires that exists in the world.

verses.latin: Ad hoc autem curam omnem subinferentes, ministrate in fide vestra virtutem, in virtute autem scientiam,
verses.english:
For this very reason, apply all diligence and effort.
To your faith, add virtue.
To virtue, add knowledge.

verses.latin: in scientia autem abstinentiam, in abstinentia patientiam, in patientia autem pietatem,
verses.english:
To knowledge, add self-control.
To self-control, add patience.
To patience, add godliness.

verses.latin: in pietate autem amorem fraternitatis, in amore autem fraternitatis caritatem.
verses.english:
To godliness, add brotherly love.
And to brotherly love, add the highest form of love: charity.

verses.latin: Hæc enim si in vobis adsunt, et superabundant, non vacuos nec infructuosos vos constituent in Domini nostri Iesu Christi cognitione.
verses.english:
For if these virtues are present in you and are growing in abundance,
they will ensure you are not idle or unfruitful in your knowledge of Our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Cui enim non præsto sunt hæc, cæcus est, et manu tentans, oblivionem faciens purgationis veterum suorum delictorum.
verses.english:
But anyone who lacks these virtues is spiritually blind and shortsighted.
They have forgotten that they were cleansed from their past sins.

verses.latin: Quam ob rem magis fratres, satagite ut per bona opera certam vestram vocationem, et electionem faciatis: hæc enim facientes, non peccabitis aliquando.
verses.english:
Therefore, brothers, strive all the more diligently
to confirm your calling and election by performing good works.
For if you do these things, you will never stumble into sin.

verses.latin: Sic enim abundanter ministrabitur vobis introitus in æternum regnum Domini nostri, et Salvatoris Iesu Christi.
verses.english:
For in this way, a rich and abundant entrance will be granted to you
into the eternal heavenly kingdom of Our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Propter quod incipiam vos semper monere de his: et quidem scientes, et confirmatos in præsenti veritate.
verses.english:
Because of this, I will always be ready to remind you of these spiritual truths,
even though you already know them and are firmly established in the present truth.

verses.latin: Æstimabo autem justum: quamdiu sum in hoc tabernaculo, suscitare vos in commonitione:
verses.english:
Indeed, I consider it right and proper
that as long as I am in this earthly body—my temporary dwelling—
I should stir you up by constantly reminding you of these things.

verses.latin: certus quod velox est depositio tabernaculi mei secundum quod et Dominus noster Iesus Christus significavit mihi.
verses.english:
I know that my time for laying aside this earthly body is coming quickly,
just as Our Lord Jesus Christ Himself revealed to me.

verses.latin: Daborum autem et omnem curam, ut et post obitum meum sæpe habeatis horum memoriam facere.
verses.english:
I will also take every care and do my utmost
so that even after my death, you may often be able to recall these spiritual truths.

verses.latin: Non enim doctas fabulas secuti, notam fecimus vobis Domini nostri Iesu Christi virtutem, et præsentiam: sed speculatores facti illius magnitudinis.
verses.english:
We did not make known to you the power and the coming of Our Lord Jesus Christ by following cleverly invented stories or myths.
Instead, we were eyewitnesses of His glorious majesty.

verses.latin: Accipiens enim a Deo Patre honorem, et gloriam, voce delapsa ad eum hujuscemodi a magnifica gloria: Hic est Filius meus dilectus, in quo mihi complacui.
verses.english:
For He received honor and glory from God the Father
when a voice came to Him from the magnificent glory of God, saying:
"This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased."

verses.latin: Et hanc vocem nos audivimus de cælo prolatam, cum essemus cum illo in monte sancto.
verses.english:
And we ourselves heard this very voice coming forth from the sky,
when we were with Him on the holy mountain during His Transfiguration.

verses.latin: Et habemus firmiorem propheticum sermonem: cui benefacitis attendentes quasi lucernæ lucenti in caliginoso loco donec dies illucescat, et lucifer oriatur in cordibus vestris.
verses.english:
And we possess the prophetic word, which is now even more firm and reliable.
You do well to pay attention to it, just as to a lamp shining in a dark and obscure place.
Pay attention to it until the full light of day breaks forth, and Christ, the Morning Star, arises in your hearts.

verses.latin: Hoc primum scientes, quod omnis prophetia Scripturæ propria interpretatione non fit.
verses.english:
Know this above all else:
no prophecy in Sacred Scripture comes from a prophet’s own private interpretation.

verses.latin: Non enim voluntate humana allata est aliquando prophetia: sed Spiritu Sancto inspirati, locuti sunt sancti Dei homines.
verses.english:
For prophecy was never brought forth by human will or intention.
Instead, holy men of God spoke as they were inspired and moved by the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Fuerunt vero et pseudoprophetae in populo, sicut et in vobis erunt magistri mendaces, qui introducent sectas perditionis, et Dominum qui emit eos, negantes, superducentes sibi celerem perditionem.
verses.english: However, there were also false prophets among God's people, just as there will be false teachers among you, who will secretly bring in destructive heresies. They will even deny the Master, Jesus Christ, who bought them and redeemed them, thereby bringing swift and immediate destruction upon themselves.

verses.latin: Et multi sequentur eorum luxurias: per quos via veritatis blasphemabitur.
verses.english: And many will follow their depraved ways and their licentiousness, through whom the way of truth will be slandered and blasphemed.

verses.latin: Et in avaritia fictis verbis de vobis negotiabuntur: quibus judicium jam olim non cessat: et perditio eorum non dormitat.
verses.english: And out of their greed, they will exploit you for profit with their fabricated stories. For them, judgment, decreed long ago, has not been idle; and their destined destruction does not sleep.

verses.latin: Si enim Deus angelis peccantibus non pepercit: sed rudentibus inferni detractos in tartarum tradidit cruciandos, in judicium reservari.
verses.english: For if God did not spare angels when they sinned, but cast them down to hell, delivering them into chains of gloom and the lowest part of the underworld to be kept for torment until the final judgment,

verses.latin: Et originali mundo non pepercit, sed octavum Noe justitiae praeconem custodivit, diluvium mundo impiorum inducens.
verses.english: and if He did not spare the ancient world, but preserved Noah, a preacher of righteousness, along with seven other people, when He brought a flood upon the world of the ungodly;

verses.latin: Et civitates Sodomorum et Gomorrhaeorum succendens evertit: in exemplum eorum qui impie acturi sunt, ponens.
verses.english: and if He condemned the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah to destruction by burning them to ashes, making them an example for those who would live ungodly lives in the future;

verses.latin: Et justum Lot oppressum a nefandorum injuria ac conversatione eruit:
verses.english: and if He rescued righteous Lot, who was distressed by the indecent conduct and corrupt lifestyle of lawless men —

verses.latin: Aspectu enim et auditu justus: habitans apud eos, qui de die in diem animam justam iniquis operibus cruciabant.
verses.english: for that righteous man, as he lived among them, was tormented in his righteous soul day after day by their lawless deeds that he saw and heard —

verses.latin: Scit Dominus pios de tentatione eripere, impios vero in diem judicii reservare cruciandos.
verses.english: then the Lord knows how to rescue the devout from temptation, and to keep the unrighteous under punishment until the day of judgment, to be tormented.

verses.latin: Maxime autem eos qui post carnem in concupiscentia immunditiae ambulant, dominationemque contemnunt, audaces, sibi placentes, majestatem blasphemantes non metuunt.
verses.english: This is especially true for those who indulge the flesh in its corrupt desires and despise authority. They are bold and arrogant, and they do not tremble when they slander glorious beings and heavenly majesties.

verses.latin: Ubi angeli fortitudine et virtute cum sint majores, non portant adversum se blasphemiam judicii.
verses.english: Whereas angels, who are greater in strength and power, do not bring a slanderous judgment against them before the Lord.

verses.latin: Hi vero velut irrationabilia pecora, natura in captionem et in perniciem nata, in his quae ignorant blasphemantes, in corruptione sua et peribunt.
verses.english: But these people, like unreasoning animals, are creatures of mere instinct, born only to be caught and destroyed. They slander what they do not understand, and in their own corruption, they will also perish.

verses.latin: Recipientes mercedem injustitiae, voluptates existimantes diei delicias: coinquinationes et maculae, deliciis affluentes in suis erroribus, convivantium vobiscum.
verses.english: They will suffer the penalty for their wrongdoing. They consider luxurious living in broad daylight a pleasure. They are stains and blemishes, reveling in their deceptions while they feast with you.

verses.latin: Oculos habentes plenos adulterii, et incessabiles delicti: pellicientes animas instabiles, cor exercitatum avaritia habentes, filii maledictionis:
verses.english: Their eyes are full of adultery and never stop sinning. They entice unstable souls, and they have hearts trained in greed. They are children of curse and deserving of divine punishment.

verses.latin: Derelinquentes rectam viam erraverunt, secuti sunt viam Balaam ex Bosor, qui mercedem iniquitatis amavit:
verses.english: They have forsaken the right way and gone astray, having followed the way of Balaam, son of Bosor, who loved the wages of wickedness.

verses.latin: Correptionem vero habuit suae praevaricationis: subjugale mutum in hominis voce loquens, prohibuit prophetae insipientiam.
verses.english: But he was rebuked for his transgression: a dumb beast of burden, speaking with a human voice, restrained the prophet’s madness.

verses.latin: Hi sunt fontes absque aqua, et nebulae turbinibus exagitatae: quibus caligo tenebrarum reservatur.
verses.english: These men are springs without water, and mists driven by a storm. For them, the deepest gloom of darkness is reserved for all eternity.

verses.latin: Superba enim loquentes vanitatis, pelliciunt in desideriis carnis luxuriae eos, qui paululum effugiunt, qui in errore conversantur:
verses.english: For, by uttering proud words of emptiness and vainglory, they entice, through sensual desires of the flesh and licentiousness, those who are barely escaping from those who live in error and unbelief.

verses.latin: Libertatem illis promittentes, cum ipsi servi sint corruptionis: cujus enim quis est superatus, hujus et servus est.
verses.english: They promise them freedom, though they themselves are slaves of corruption. For by whatever a person is overcome, by that he is enslaved.

verses.latin: Si enim reverterunt a coinquinationibus mundi, cognitione Domini nostri, et Salvatoris Jesu Christi: his rursus implicati superantur: facta sunt illis posteriora deteriora prioribus.
verses.english: For if, after escaping the pollutions of the world through the saving knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, they are again entangled in them and overcome, their latter state has become worse for them than the former.

verses.latin: Melius enim erat illis non cognoscere viam justitiae, quam post agnitionem retrorsum converti ab eo quod illis traditum est sancto mandato.
verses.english: For it would have been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than having known it, to turn back from the holy commandment delivered to them.

verses.latin: Contigit enim eis illud veri proverbii: Canis reversus ad suum vomitum: et sus lota in volutabro luti.
verses.english: What happened to them is described by the true proverb: 'A dog returns to its own vomit,' and, 'A sow, after washing, returns to wallowing in the mud and filth.'

verses.latin: Hanc vobis, charissimi, secundam scribo epistolam, in quibus utraque excito vestram in commemorationem sinceram mentem:
verses.english: Beloved brothers and sisters, I am writing this second letter to you. In both of these letters, I am stirring up your sincere minds by reminding you of important truths,

verses.latin: ut memores sitis eorum, quae praedixi, verborum a sanctis prophetis, et apostolorum vestrorum, mandati Domini, et Salvatoris.
verses.english: so that you may remember the words that the holy prophets foretold and the commandment given by our Lord and Savior through your Apostles.

verses.latin: Hoc primum scientes, quia venient in novissimis diebus in deceptione illusores, juxta proprias concupiscentias ambulantes,
verses.english: You should know this first and foremost: that in the last days, deceivers will come to mock you. They will live according to their own sinful desires and lead others into deception.

verses.latin: dicentes: Ubi est promissio, aut adventus ejus? ex quo enim patres dormierunt, omnia sic perseverant ab initio creaturae.
verses.english: They will say, 'Where is the promise of His coming?' They will claim that since our ancestors died, everything has continued exactly as it was from the very beginning of creation, implying that Christ will not return.

verses.latin: Latet enim eos hoc volentes, quod caeli erant prius, et terra de aqua, et per aquam consistens Dei verbo:
verses.english: They willfully ignore the truth that the universe existed before the Flood, and the earth was formed out of water and structured by water through the creative Word of God.

verses.latin: per quae, et ille mundus tunc aquae inundatione perierat.
verses.english: And it was by these very waters that the world of that time was utterly destroyed by the great flood.

verses.latin: Caeli autem, qui nunc sunt, et terra eodem verbo repositi sunt, igni reservati in diem judicii, et perditionis impiorum hominum.
verses.english: But the present universe and the earth, by the same divine Word, are being preserved. They are reserved for fire on the Day of Judgment, when all ungodly people will be destroyed.

verses.latin: Unum vero hoc non lateat vos, charissimi, quia unus dies apud Dominum sicut mille anni, et mille anni sicut dies unus.
verses.english: However, beloved brothers and sisters, do not let this one thing escape your notice: that with the Lord, one day is like a thousand years, and a thousand years are like one day. This means that God is not limited by our human perception of time.

verses.latin: Non tardat Dominus promissionis, sicut quidam tarditatem æstimant: sed patienter agit propter vos, nolens aliquos perire, sed omnes ad poenitentiam reverti.
verses.english: The Lord is not slow concerning His promise, as some people consider it slowness. Instead, He is patiently waiting because of you. He does not want anyone to perish, but for all to return to repentance and be saved.

verses.latin: Adveniet autem dies Domini sicut fur: in quo caeli magno impetu transient, et elementa ardore solventur, et terra, et quae in ipsa sunt opera, exurentur.
verses.english: But the Day of the Lord will come unexpectedly, like a thief in the night. On that Day, the heavens—meaning the created universe—will pass away with a tremendous roar, and the basic elements of matter will be dissolved by intense heat. The earth and all its works and structures will be burned up.

verses.latin: Cum igitur haec omnia dissolvenda sint, quales oportet vos esse in sanctis conversationibus, et pietatibus,
verses.english: Since all these things are to be dissolved in such a way, what kind of people ought you to be in holy conduct and acts of piety, preparing yourselves for that Day?

verses.latin: expectantes, et properantes in adventum diei Domini, per quem caeli ardentes solventur, et elementa ignis ardore tabescent?
verses.english: You should be eagerly awaiting and hastening the coming of the Day of the Lord, the Day by which the burning universe will be dissolved, and the basic elements of all matter will melt away in the fervent heat of the fire.

verses.latin: Novos vero caelos, et novam terram secundum promissa ipsius expectamus, in quibus justitia habitat.
verses.english: But we eagerly await a new universe and a new earth according to His promise—a creation in which perfect righteousness will permanently dwell.

verses.latin: Propter quod, charissimi, haec expectantes, satagite immaculati, et irreprehensibiles ei inveniri in pace:
verses.english: Therefore, beloved brothers and sisters, since you are awaiting these glorious things, strive diligently to be found by Him without any moral stain and blameless, living in peace.

verses.latin: et Domini nostri longanimitatem, salutem arbitramini: sicut et charissimus frater noster Paulus secundum datam sibi sapientiam scripsit vobis,
verses.english: And consider the long-suffering patience of our Lord to be for your salvation—a truth that our beloved brother Paul also wrote to you, according to the divine wisdom given to him.

verses.latin: sicut et in omnibus epistolis, loquens in eis de his, in quibus sunt quaedam dura intellectu, quae indocti, et instabiles depravant, sicut et ceteras Scripturas, ad suam ipsorum perditionem.
verses.english: He speaks of these matters in all his letters. Some things in his letters are difficult to understand, and these difficult passages are twisted and distorted by ignorant and unstable people, just as they distort the other Holy Scriptures, leading to their own eternal destruction.

verses.latin: Vos igitur, fratres, praescientes custodite vos, ne insipientium errore traducti excidatis a propria firmitate:
verses.english: Therefore, beloved brothers, since you have been forewarned of these things, be on your guard so that you may not be led astray by the error of these foolish people and fall from your own steadfastness in the faith.

verses.latin: crescere vero in gratia, et in cognitione Domini nostri, et Salvatoris Jesu Christi. Ipsi gloria, et nunc, et in diem æternitatis. Amen.
verses.english: Instead, grow in the grace and in the full, saving knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To Him be all glory, both now and for the Day of eternity. Amen.
